conclusion: At steady state the capacitor is an open circuit (no dc current through it).
The branch containing the capacitor and R₂ is open; only the branch containing R₁ and R₃ carries current supplied by the source.
The current I flowing from the source is found from the series resistance R₁ + R₃ together with the source’s internal resistance r.
Req = r + R₁ + R₃ = 2 Ω + 2 Ω + 6 Ω = 10 Ω
I = E / Req = 6 V / 10 Ω = 0.60 A
The potential difference between the two horizontal nodes equals the drop across R₁.
Vnode = I · R₁ = 0.60 A × 2 Ω = 1.2 V
This node-to-node voltage is the voltage across the capacitor after a long time.
Charge on the capacitor after the circuit stabilizes: Q = 1.2 × 10⁻⁵ C (12 μC).
